pageContext.claim: “Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador … We couldn't bring them back; they wouldn't take them. They'd send them to us. They were vicious criminals, in some cases, and when they brought them back under the past administration, they wouldn't take them. So we'd end up bringing them back. Now, they take them back gladly.”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, the Obama administration prioritized the deportations of gang members and individuals with criminal records. Thousands of such migrants were returned to El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras during the Obama administration, according to statistics from the Department of Homeland Security.
